grape.embiggen.embedders.optimizers.centralize_gradient package

Submodules

grape.embiggen.embedders.optimizers.centralize_gradient.apply_centralized_gradients module

grape.embiggen.embedders.optimizers.centralize_gradient.apply_centralized_gradients.apply_centralized_gradients(optimizers)[source]

Replaces the get_gradients method with the one centralizing the gradient.

grape.embiggen.embedders.optimizers.centralize_gradient.get_centralized_gradient module

grape.embiggen.embedders.optimizers.centralize_gradient.get_centralized_gradient.get_centralized_gradient(gradient)[source]

Centralize over zero mean the provided gradient.

Parameters

gradient (tf.Tensor,) – Gradient to centralize over zero mean.

References

[Gradient Centralization: A New Optimization Technique for Deep Neural Networks](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.01461.pdf)

Return type

Tensor

grape.embiggen.embedders.optimizers.centralize_gradient.get_centralized_gradients module

grape.embiggen.embedders.optimizers.centralize_gradient.get_centralized_gradients.get_centralized_gradients(optimizer, loss, params)[source]

Centralize over zero mean all the provided gradients.

Parameters

  • optimizer (Optimizer,) – The optimizer instance (e.g. Adam, Nadam, …)

  • loss (tf.Tensor,) – The loss function of this model.

  • params (List,) – Parameters relevant to the computation of the gradient.

References

[Gradient Centralization: A New Optimization Technique for Deep Neural Networks](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.01461.pdf)

Return type

List
